bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Bertha L. Lyons, April 29, 1948

div1.p: Hench provides Lyons with information on Camp Lazear Building No. 1, to be used in a Hall of Fame exhibit on Reed.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Bertha L. Lyons, April 29, 1948
div1.opener:
Charge to the account of COLLECT $____________
WESTERN
UNION
JOSEPH L. EGAN
PRESIDENT
1206
__________________________________________________
Send the following telegram, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
April 29, 1948
Miss Bertha L. Lyons
Assistant to the Director
Hall of Fame, New York University
1 Madison Avenue
New York, New York
div1.p:
Fomites experiments done in Building One which remains. Infected mosquito
experiments done Building 2 since destroyed. In certain Army publications
and in Kelly's book captions wrong, building numbers having been erroneously
interchanged. Suggested caption: Remains of Reed's Building Number 1 where
fomites experiments with infected clothing, etc., performed.
